words.title: Professor
words.def: a university teacher of the highest rank
words.sample: He was made (a) professor at the age of 40.

words.title: Library
words.def: a building in which collections of books, CDs, newspapers, etc. are kept for people to read, study or borrow
words.sample: a new edition to add to your library.

words.title: Laboratory
words.def: a room or building used for scientific research, experiments, testing, etc.
words.sample: to send a specimen to the laboratory for analysis.

words.title: Lecture hall
words.def: a large room with rows of seats on a slope, where lectures are given
words.sample: We learn Math at GD2 Lecture hall.

words.title: Diploma
words.def: a course of study at a college or university
words.sample: She is taking a diploma in management studies.

words.title: Money
words.def: what you earn by working or selling things, and use to buy things
words.sample: How much money is there in my account?

words.title: Check
words.def: a document that orders a bank to pay a specific amount of money from a person's account

words.title: Safe
words.def: a strong metal box or cupboard with a complicated lock, used for storing valuable things in.
words.sample: She keeps all her money in the safe box.

words.title: Interest
words.def: the extra money that you pay back when you borrow money or that you receive when you invest money
words.sample: The money was repaid with interest.

words.title: Deposit
words.def: a sum of money that is given as the first part of a larger payment
words.sample: They'll probably ask you to leave a deposit.
